text: Is there any support for using a setTimeout?  I was trying to automatically dismiss an Alert.
setTimeout should work but you can't dismiss alerts

Oh, interesting, i'll keep testing, but it seemed like my timeout wasn't executing.  Why can't we dismiss alerts?  This should just be changing a state variable to hide an element.  I can dismiss with a button, but was trying to do it with a timer so the user wouldnt have to always click.

sorry I'm not seeing a way to dismiss an alert, <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extensions-sdk#display-alert-banners>
You can click the close button on the alert itself or you can just wait for it to go away after a couple of seconds
they automatically go away after 3 seconds I believe
I was using the Alert element directly, didn't notice this api.  This seems a better approach, i'll give it a shot. Thanks!
of course!
<@U05ENUJF7B5> this might be a good thing to put in the alert component docs, just mentioning that you should probably be using the sendAlert function instead of the component directly

Thanks for the callout <@U01QVR44MEY>! I’ll submit a change request to our technical writers.

Did you happen to see the new :beta: of the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/ui-components/ui-extension-components|docs> out today?!
Yeah! I've been working with the team on it for the last couple of months, so good!
Hello! I just lost my custom integration cards that I need.  I noticed the extension was made to last through June 30th, 2024, but I lost mine today! How can I get them back??
Hello Andrea, could you please tell me your portal ID and project name?
Hi <@UNHBK8QNM> the portal ID is 22772793
Thank you, taking a look now.
Within the next few minutes the cards should be showing up again after a page reload. Let us know if you continue to see any issues.
OMG - thank you!!!
So we have until 6/30/24?
Yep, that's correct.
Thank you! It seems to be working now.  Very much appreciate the help!
Great! Happy to help.

We’ve been using the notes for a while, but using property list seems like a much better option then notes however the new field does not store the file as an attachment on the object, and only within the field - makes it a bit of a process change for reps who are used to using the attachments, but also not a big deal since adding the field to the sidebar somewhere visible is easy. 

Thanks for sharing this over!
